text: The 2019 Coupe de France Final was a football match between Rennes and Paris Saint-Germain to decide the winner of the 2018–19 Coupe de France, the 102nd season of the Coupe de France. Rennes won the cup, their first since 1971, after a penalty shoot-out following a 2–2 draw in extra time. ==Route to the final== {| style="width:100%; text-align:center;" |- style="vertical- align:top; background:#9cf;" !colspan=2 style="width:1*"|Rennes !Round !colspan=2 style="width:1*"|Paris Saint-Germain |- style="vertical-align:top; background:#c1e0ff;" |Opponent |Result ||2018–19 Coupe de France |Opponent |Result |- |Brest |2–2 (5–4 pen.) (H) | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Round of 64 |Pontivy |4–0 (A) |- |Saint-Pryvé |2–0 (A) | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Round of 32 |Strasbourg |2–0 (H) |- |Lille |2–1 (H) | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Round of 16 |Villefranche |3–0 (A) |- |Orléans |2–0 (H) | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Quarter-finals |Dijon |3–0 (H) |- |Lyon |3–2 (A) | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Semi-finals |Nantes |3–0 (H) |} Note: H = home fixture, A = away fixture ==Match== ===Details=== {| width=92% |- | | |} {| width="100%" |valign="top" width="40%"| {| style="font- size:90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |- !width=25| !!width=25| |- |GK ||40|| Tomáš Koubek |- |RB ||27|| Hamari Traoré |- |CB ||3 || Damien Da Silva |- |CB ||4 || Mexer || |- |LB ||15|| Ramy Bensebaini || |- |CM ||21|| Benjamin André (c) || |- |CM ||8 || Clément Grenier || |- |RW ||7 || Ismaïla Sarr |- |AM ||18|| Hatem Ben Arfa |- |LW ||14|| Benjamin Bourigeaud || || |- |CF ||11|| M'Baye Niang || |- |colspan=3|Substitutes: |- |GK ||16|| Abdoulaye Diallo |- |DF ||2 || Mehdi Zeffane |- |DF ||26|| Jérémy Gelin |- |MF ||6 || Jakob Johansson |- |MF ||12|| James Léa Siliki || || |- |MF ||22|| Romain Del Castillo |- |MF ||23|| Adrien Hunou |- |colspan=3|Manager: |- |colspan=3| Julien Stéphan |} |valign="top"|300px |valign="top" width="50%"| {| style="font-size:90%;
